snippet: The issue of affirmative action for Muslims surfaced in an election in Uttar Pradesh, with promises to Muslims of quotas like those for low-caste Hindus.
abstract: Samajwadi Party, victors of upset election in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh, have promised to institute affirmative action programs for the country's Muslim minority; Muslims have fallen badly behind other Indians in socioeconomic status since the country became democratic; plan would follow in the footsteps of steps taken to elevate low-caste Hindus to higher-paying jobs.
lead_paragraph: The issue of affirmative action for Muslims surfaced in an election in Uttar Pradesh, with promises to Muslims of quotas like those for low-caste Hindus.

headline.seo: India Eyes Affirmative Action for Muslims
headline.main: India Eyes Muslims Left Behind by Quota System
headline.print_headline: After Lifting Lowest Hindus, India Eyes the Muslims Left Behind
